website_summaries.verdict: Low volume option for home/ home office users. Auto duplex printing and wide ranging compatibility.
pros: Good quality printing, plus copying and scanning in a compact, space-saving unit
Prints wirelessly from tablets and smartphones
Will take XL cartridges for increased economy
One of the cheapest printers on the market
cons: The WiFi signal can drop out, needing a restart

customer_reviews.title: It looks amazing but it is the cheapest quality printer I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay for the price , especially if your printing needs are minimal. It looks amazing but it is the cheapest quality printer I have ever purchased, just don’t touch anything or be careful when you move it around or the cheap plastic will fall apart. The setup process is comical, it is a combination of your laptop, their 2inch lcd screen and the front panel . Other than that this is a great printer. Update 10days later, the wireless stopped working, after spending 3hours with the support I finally gave up and returned this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: HZ

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT connect to mobile devices via Bluetooth. I am furious because I bought this model specifically because it says it is bluetooth enabled and is compatible with iOS devices (provided its 9.0 or higher). It will not function like this. With the non-sharing restrictions on the wireless in this printers location, bluetooth is the only option to connect this to the iPad in aforementioned location. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Freyja

customer_reviews.title: Other negative reviews made me nervous, but...
customer_reviews.text: All the other negative reviews about the setup process almost scared me away from this printer, but I'm glad I bought it anyway! I really don't understand what everyone was complaining about. I easily followed the directions and got the printer connected to my laptop and smartphone via WiFi even though I am not super tech savvy. So far this thing seams great especially for such a low price. It may not keep up with heavy duty printing needs, but it gets 5 stars from me because its exactly what I needed for the lowest price I saw when shopping around!
customer_reviews.author: Julia M

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: I gave it three stars because the setup was so easy and the printer is cute. However, I started printing tonight and I notice that each page it printed got duller. Also even though I set it to black and white only, the thing used up almost all of my colored ink. Very disappointed about that especially since I read that if there is no colored cartridge in the printer it won’t work (not sure how truthful that is) but then it has to be since it used up half my colored even though it was set to B&W only. Note that this was my first time using I received the item today
customer_reviews.author: Princess Kay

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This printer has never worked like it’s supposed to. It a cheap product and very unstable plastic. Already broken. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: I've never used a printer this annoying!
customer_reviews.text: When a printer is this finicky where it prompts you every 5 seconds to do something in order to just print a simple document; close this, open that, wrong door/slot, adjust paper size, wrong paper type, blah blah blah... it would be easier to just buy a different printer that is more simplified, one where you open the paper tray and place the paper in and guess what it just prints without prompting you to change everything like you're working under a car hood. This is not that printer.
customer_reviews.author: Nagini

customer_reviews.title: Life is too short to own this printer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this printer about six months. I avoid using it because my blood pressure skyrockets every time!!! I hit print and get a message to register the paper slot. It automatically goes to the rear, so I add paper to the rear slot. Then I get a message to close the rear slot so I can print. Then AGAIN, I get a message to put paper in the rear slot😡. Hate this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ann Beaugez

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to reset the wireless in the settings every time I wanted to print. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: dave Weisbaum

customer_reviews.title: The worst printer I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Usually I have had great luck with Canon Printers. This one was apparently designed while the software engineer was using something. First few weeks it was ok. Then it started telling me the computer was offline when it was online. Then it wouldn't print at all. Its latest affectation is to print only the last page of a document and give me an error message and tell me how to correct it. It didn't work. I've re-installed the drivers more than once. This one is going to recycling and I hope to get a better product the next time.
customer_reviews.author: ElinRW

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer ive ever owned. Printed about 20 sheets max before ink ran out. Got more ink. Upon every use paper jammed. . Took 1-2 minutes to even print when it worked . I got so frustrated i slammed it on my drive way and broke it. Would have game 0 stars but i had to at least give 1 to submit my review
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Must have patience and some computer knowledge
customer_reviews.text: Geez! What happened to plug and print? Good lord! It took me nearly an hour to get this darn printer to be recognized. Followed directions TO THE T and “device is already registered” so I had to figure it out by myself only to Then get “device not found” message! I did, however, get it printing and I have NO idea what I did! So now that it’s going, it’s AWESOME. I just wanted to share my frustration. (I connect with iPhone/iPad through wireless router)
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: As bad a printer as i have experienced
customer_reviews.text: UI is out of the 90's. some things i have experienced: print queue does not update and doesn't allow the next job to print. when it does print it sometimes prints and sometimes just stays on processing for many minutes until i reboot the printer, cancel the print job and resubmit. get error message about the rear paper tray when i have never used nor put any paper in the rear paper slot. copy won't copy consistently without the same kind of reboot. have to say that the scan works well. too bad i let it sit in the box for two weeks before i hooked it up. can't get refund now. well at least i have a scanner.
customer_reviews.author: TMcDonald Boulder

customer_reviews.title: You dont need a windows or mac computer/pc for the initial setup.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good printer.Just to let you know you dont need a windows or mac computer for the initial setup .I used my Samsung galaxy s8+ for the initial/general setup all you need to do is download the app because I dont own neither of those computers I own a chromebook and it works fine.It comes with black and white ink and color ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Perez

customer_reviews.title: Easy print from iPhone connon app
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why people are crying so much about this printer.. believe me for $40 dollars you are getting a lot more than what you are paying for and besides a huge plus it already comes with ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian09

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy printer to set up. Follow the instructions is all you have to do. Took me 5 minutes. Prints very well and good quality. It even prints double sided!! It’s pretty quiet too. It’s a great quality printer for a wonderful price. I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Inexpensive ink refills. I needed a printer for school as I print a lot. Having previously owned HP printers the ink replacements were very expensive, and I would always have issues with them. I came across this Canon printer and compared the prices with ink replacements and it was way cheaper than the HPs. I've been using it for a few months now and no issues what so ever. Prints faster than my previous printers.
customer_reviews.author: R.F

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon printer for years and loved it. It finally stopped talking to my computer! This "newer and updated" version is crap!! The design is ugly! It does not hold both paper and photo paper in the trays (always ready for use), it will not stay on!!! EVERY time I print, I have to go turn it back on!!! Pitiful!! And , of course, the ink costs MORE than the printer did!! I'll be getting another one!! Would NOT recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: cathy adams

customer_reviews.title: great printer!
customer_reviews.text: great printer. i bought this printer to print return labels and airplane tickets. prior to this i was forwarding these to the office to print but for $50 i can have my privacy! this printer alow me to print from my ipad, iphone and samsung s9 phone. it was a bit tricky to set it up but if you know your way around the wifi setting you should have no problem. the only thing i would ding this printer on is that it is a little slow.....besides that for what we needed from a printer it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Ironman&Ultrarunner

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Maddening
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this printer on WIFI with a laptop, it will routinely (almost every time it is used) grab a random IP address and the laptop will not be able to find it. I have had to call Canon technical support multiple times and they do not have a fix for the underlying issue. After being on the phone with them for 15-20 minutes, we can get it to work but the next time I turn the laptop on, it has lost the printer again. It is incredibly frustrating. This issue renders the printer virtually unusable.
customer_reviews.author: William Hayse

customer_reviews.title: Low price but high quality
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon printers and was worried since this one was so cheap that it wouldn’t work well at all. But it surprised me and works great for being such a low price!! It does all of the printing, scanning and copying I need and is wireless! I definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it's fine, but it's tempermental.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for a while now. It periodically forgets how to operate and I have to reinstall the drivers. No rhyme or reason. Reinstalling the software on each and every computer in the house every time this turd has a conniption fit is annoying. I will not be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Printer works very well and product support was good.
customer_reviews.text: A nice little printer from Canon. It works well and seems to be designed well. The only problem I had was getting the photo function to work properly. I did email product support at Canon and they emailed me back a user easy fix and that did the job so I am happy with Canon so far.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible w/Chromebook for scanning.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the printing and copying features of this product and it was very easy to connect it to Google print. However, although this is an all-in-one printer, scanner and copier that is compatible with Google Print, it is not compatible for scanning so, if you have a Chromebook and need to scan, it won't work. It can only scan with Windows or Mac OSX computer (per customer service trouble shooting response).
customer_reviews.author: Monica K. Henry

customer_reviews.title: It’s a really crappy, cheap printer. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst printer I’ve ever used. Does not work on modern 5Ghz Wifi, does not have a USB slot for scanning to or printing from when you can’t get it on your 5Ghz network, also no Ethernet port so you can’t go wired either. Couldn’t print a 20 page PowerPoint for class. I guess the internals were to small for a file that size. Did manage to print a 5 page word document eventually. Went to highlight something about half an hour later and the ink smeared badly (ink was definitely dry). Man what a disappointment from an “Amazon’s Choice” product. First time I’ve been shafted by Amazon, their recommendations are usually good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've had this now for two months. I can't get over how long the starter ink cartridges are lasting. Set-up was easy, just followed the clear step-by-step instructions. Using the different functions took a little getting used to, but once learned this printer is a delight to use. This printer replaced a similar (i.e., price and functions) Canon FINE printer that I had for nearly ten years, printed thousands (no exaggeration) of sheets, no problems whatsoever, never had a paper jam, but something about ink overflow absorbers being full that I couldn't figure out how to replace, so I figured it must be time to get a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Paramahamsa Bobananda

customer_reviews.title: works well enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely more suited for home use and people that don't need to print often. I only use it occasionally, so for the price point and compact size that does not take up too much space, I'm happy with it. As other people have said in reviews, the setup is more difficult and takes longer than other printers I have used but it's still pretty simple. It's easy to print from your phone but it does print slow and I have to turn it on every time I want to print something. Works well enough for what I need in a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Miraclemike3

customer_reviews.title: Detected but would never finish set up process
customer_reviews.text: If I could leave no star I would. I am on my third Canon printer I have two MG3620's and after about a year the alignment gets off and cannot be fixed so I wanted to try a different model but PC would instantly detect new hardware but the Canon set up process would never finish. I tried mobile and hardwired and none worked, was forced to return.
customer_reviews.author: MELINDA NICHOLS

customer_reviews.title: horrible
customer_reviews.text: got this and was difficult to set up??? Im pretty tech savvy, or maybe WIFI printing is a thing of the past??? not even in the directions, maybe an old way of doing, but the directions wanted you to download something on EVERY device you want to print from.... I was going to return, and thought one last try, and googled how to set up wifi printing... a ! ONE PAPER JAM, and it no longer works, and for some reason it is 40.00 more o buy a new one????? BUYT THE WARRANTY, mine is still under but will probably cost more to send it in than to just throw away
customer_reviews.author: newshower

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHOICE FOR ALL IN ONE
customer_reviews.text: Prints really well and for me the winning features are wifi and apple AirPrint support and also automatic double sided printing!!! I you are thinking in buying, Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating to troubleshoot this stupid Canon TS5120 printer. No way should anyone buy this. Constantly says it's offline and won't print but it isn't actually offline therefore I need to uninstall then reinstall the thing just about every time I want to print and that isn't very often! I really hate this printer!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this printer for a few months now and it still works wonderfully. I use it on occasion to print forms and such for work, but i have not tried printing a lot of forms at one time. The most ive printed so far was 100 pages and it did great. The only concern I have is the front piece that comes out when in use seems flimsy and I feel like it would break with little pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Zaina

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Special but Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Great if you want to print text, not good if you want to print something with color. I had a project to do and every time I needed to print something with color I would notice these weird lines running across the page. It's great if you don't want to go all out and buy an expensive printer because it gets the job done and it's pretty cheap. Of course if you need something better I would suggest investing more money, which is what I'm planning to do in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Call help desk for set up
customer_reviews.text: Wi fi set up instructions incomplete It took 2 hours to set up and 1/2 hour to get the paper tray set to print Operation seems ok but instructions were not good The set up navigation the help desk took me through was not included in the instructions which led to frustration.
customer_reviews.author: vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Not so Mac friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I have an iMac so it was a little tedious to setup. I’ve had to call support twice because suddenly my mac can’t “find” the printer. I even started using a usb cable and it still acts up. Canon support was great but claims it’s my iMac. But yet my older canon printer never had issues. Also they don’t have drivers yet for the newest Mac OS. I’m amazed that it prints double sided. I think that’s the coolest things ever.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Eye

customer_reviews.title: I should have known better
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, constantly jams or says its jammed when it's not, does not maintain settings and have to reset all the the time. Tray is flimsy. I have previously purchased very inexpensive printers and thought a Canon would be a solid choice. This is by far the worst printer I have ever owned. Even though it is brand-new, I am going to have to replace it because I don't have the energy and time to constantly troubleshoot its various problems.
customer_reviews.author: Room 24

customer_reviews.title: too many jams
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with this particular model. Always bought Canon Printers and all of them have lasted many years without any problems. This particular model, however, is not what I expected from a Canon model. Prints 3-4 pages, then I get a jam message, fix the jam, get a message that no paper is in the cartridge, but there is. I am really getting frustrated with this. Anyone else have that problem ? It that why it was on sale ? Perhaps I just got a "dud" ? Thinking of buying another printer. Not sure if it will be a Canon -- will do a little more research.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: It's a flaky printer, works one time won't the next and now 5 days past return window
customer_reviews.text: It's a flaky printer, works one time won't the next and now 5 days past return window. I kept thinking it would be ok, when it worked it worked fine but I can't tell you how many hours me and my husband spent trying to make it print. The setup was easy this is just a finicky flaky printer that is very hard to make work. Tray is so flimsy it always has a error from the tray. I need to buy something good!!! FRUSTRATED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Ink runs out too quickly
customer_reviews.text: Ink runs out at about 50 sheets of normal typed word or excel documents.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M

customer_reviews.title: SUPER slow! Short ink life.
customer_reviews.text: So far, the printing has been fine, though it's only been a couple of months. However, with VERY light printing, the ink cartridge is already out. And I'm talking maybe 50 pages is all I've printed. It is also WAY slow. I have to print with anticipating it to have to warm up, wake up, and print at the speed of my grandmother walking. It was a good price, but I would have spent more for a faster printer if I could do it again.
customer_reviews.author: M2

customer_reviews.title: Drivers are not available
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to use because I was unable to download drivers, (my CD drive isn't working on my old computer) I thought perhaps it was due to the age of my computer, (My old computer is 9 years old) I bought a new computer and when I went to download I realized the drivers are not available. I should have done more research prior to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J2012

customer_reviews.title: Broke after just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Clunky interface, badly made, poorly fitted components; it refuses to feed from the tray hopper and then it just stopped scanning, period. Last straw was the 'Canon Software Suite' having a major impact on my computer startup and performance. Never buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Julia and Erik

customer_reviews.title: not as bad as other reviewers say
customer_reviews.text: its a bit slow and was hell to get linked up through wifi. once i did get it setup i havent had many issues with it. the ink ran out fairly quick and aint the cheapest to replace, but its been a good buy and ill keep it. scanner works nice too. as others have mentioned this printer does not come with any direct connections of its own. they expect u to use wifi out of the box. it does the job though once u fight through setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: George Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer... Follow The Setup Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what all the negative feedback is about. It's a basic all-in-one that sets up easily in under 10 minutes. Like most printers it's made of plastic. It takes 2 cartridges- color and b/w which it comes with. Installation and setup was easy. I did it right from my Mac. I downloaded the software, set up the wireless and installed the printer driver on my computer. All in about three steps. I didn't have to futz around trying to enter my wifi password on the printer which is always a pain. Once it was installed and connected to wifi it worked on my iPhone and iPad as well. AirPrint was automatic. In general, a great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mobile Moses

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this printer!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this printer is cheap for the features it comes with. Setup did take a few minutes and had to download the Canon Print app to get it connected to my wifi from my phone. You can also do it on the printer. I love the AIRPRINT and GOOGLE CLOUD PRINT options. I use both, and am also able to share the printer with my friends via Google Cloud Print. The Canon Print app is neat too and allows you to print to the printer and also scan in options. Easy to use and highly recommended for the connectivity options.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: XP Compatiilty...yes
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this for my business in a pinch since my Canon mx922 got the dreaded B200 code. I overnighted it. The price was right as a cheap temporary invoice printer. Hooked it up and did not work on my XP software...a reviewer said it would work. Called Canon...hold for 20 minutes...told it will not work says so on the box. Tried to sell me an update that also only works on Windows 10. Found the driver on their web site...works great. I believe they want you to purchase new products because their software is Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Flat

customer_reviews.title: Broken Printer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible decision. Do not buy this printer. The printer does not work and there is no way to print from a computer to the printer. I am suing Cannon for defrauding me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Haney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little printer/scanner
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little printer/scanner. From reading the reviews all I know is ppl love to complain because they are a bunch of morons. Let me point out a few facts: - If you stuff the printer with paper common sense tells me of course it's going to get jammed. Duh! - Learn to follow directions. It was pretty simple, the setup and everything - Never read negative reviews because just don't otherwise you will forever end up reading negative reviews
customer_reviews.author: Saimeen Zakaria

customer_reviews.title: It’s a trap!
customer_reviews.text: It worked a cool months but somehow it broke or malfunctioned. It would still print but it makes every print job look blurry or as if you’re dizzy. I leaned online, after trying all the troubleshooting and everything, it’s not a fixable problem it must be replaced with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This printer is the worst
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this printer, it is the WORST. It looks pretty and is small. However, the wireless connection always drops and has a really hard time reconnecting, the paper jams constantly and it tells me there is no paper when the tray is full! I get insanely frustrated with this thing and it seems to never want to work when I need it most. We are doing simple things like return labels, homework papers and occasional pictures. Dont try to use any media other than paper, that really makes it mad. I almost lost my sanity trying to print onto iron on transfer paper for a Halloween costume. Stay away!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dandy

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I don’t print things often maybe once or twice a month do I need something printed. With that being said the printer worked great the first 2-3 months. It sat in the same place, never moved and one day last week I needed to print something and I got a support code error telling me to check for foreign object in the printer and that the ink cartridges are installed, after 2 hours of looking for something foreign and reinstalling ink cartridges the printer still give me a support code error. It will not print anything until the code is fixed. So never buy this thing it’s trash.
customer_reviews.author: Bekka

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Does not connect to cell phone. Not on WiFi Not on Bluetooth. I bought it specifically because it can connect by cable to my smartphone. Says USB cable. It is not. And does not come with cable. And does not say where or how to get their non-USB cable. Directions DID say to insert Cd-rom into my smartphone to load directions on how to connect to my smartphone. DO NOT BUY!!! It is the thinnest cheapest plastic I have EVER seen. The plastic package a cheap toothbrush is better. No, seriously. I can not say this strongly enough. DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Goatman

customer_reviews.title: poor design for printing
customer_reviews.text: The return paper tray is directly over the insert paper tray with about an inch of clearance so if you haveto laod more paper, you can't get your fingers in there. Also it grabs 25 sheets of paper at a time and jams every. single. time. so you have to loading one sheet at a time. Crappy design.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The worst printer I've ever owned, and I've had printers since the mid 90s. I have to print a test page each time, in order for the laptop to recognize the printer. It's NOT the laptop. Other printers I use have no issues like this. Stay away form this. Also really poor design. It's hard to even open the dumb designed control panel. They forgot to add an opening to grab it. Hard to believe, that in this competitive market, and the huge mark ups on ink, that canon would design a failure like this. The person in charge of this model should flat out be fired!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst set up ever
customer_reviews.text: The printer installation was the worst I've ever encountered ! I never could get it to connect wireless, had to run out and purchase a USB cable, if I did not have a pending project, I would have sent it back !!!!!! Worst purchase ever, I have set up many printers in my time, never again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well... Its a Printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement to another canon printer I owned before. The ink had become too expensive to where it was no longer cost effective. This one is easy to use, and I like the wireless printing feature (I had to manually connect my old one), but I will say the print quality is super low. Mine has white lines running through it after the first print, it works for small unimportant things but unfortunately I needed something that will also print detailed images in at least OK quality. This printer just blurs them. I'm also worried about how flimsy it is, I think it may break any any moment.
customer_reviews.author: Night_of_Nyx

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for College!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this printer! I bought it for college so I won’t have to fool around with the school one and have more convenance. The set up was pretty simple. The only challenging part was getting to the website to finish the set up but once I figured out where to go, it was easy. It definitely doesn’t print super quickly but it prints very well with no smears and great color. I would highly recommend this printer for someone needing a cheap but good printer.
customer_reviews.author: Maura

customer_reviews.title: Annoying feature with the door
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my MIL, as she only does limited printing. The unit hooked up easily to her Mac but trying to do a test print I kept getting an error for the paper door. It turns out you cannot print with the door all the way closed, it must be left ajar to actually print anything. This is a odd feature and just looks like lazy engineering. Should be better explained in manual, but was discovered by frustrating trial and error. Prints nicely, small footprint, and easy to use (other than stupid door).
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great smaller printer.
customer_reviews.text: I like my new printer and the quality has been very good! Couple tricky places setting it up but I got it! Got it to print from my computer and then got it to print from my phone!!! YEA! Thanks Cannon for making it pretty easy to do! I wish I had read the dimensions a little better (totally MY FAULT) because I really wanted a smaller more mobile printer, but I have enjoyed this one so much so soon, I want to keep it and use it right on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a nightmare. All I want to do is print something. meanwhile you must pick through numerous types of paper sizes, you press print.. nothing.. but more questions... I am NOT exaggerating. EVERYTHING is super complicated. It is just awful. All these complicated printing functions that are completely useless for the average person. Maybe some kind of artist might like it for something. Otherwise forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Out There

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Does not remain ready to print. You need to turn it on and open the feed tray to print. Also keeps wanting me to use the rear feed and tells me it’s out of paper. I don’t want to use the rear paper feed and have not found a way to disable it permanently. Madining! Prints ok for the cheap price. As with all printers, the ink is too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Gaynor

customer_reviews.title: A constant struggle
customer_reviews.text: These printer has been a struggle to use since I purchased more than 6 months ago. It constantly needs to be restarted because it disconnects, randomly chooses different paper sizes, won't switch back to the tray vs feed when printing, etc. I purchased it for a low price during Black Friday as a back up printer and despite only using once in a while, I am looking at getting a new one because it is too time consuming to fuss with.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: nice  compact printer, very easy to install and  use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer for my wife because she was getting mad at me using the printer all the time and using all the ink. This printer is great!! best feature is that it is wireless so that means one less cable for the cats to sit on and disconnect. Instructions are wonderfully clear and easy to follow. GREAT investment for the cost. This is obviously not a heavy use printer, but given that the wife uses a printer about once every couple of weeks this is an ideal solution. I am giving it five stars. ALSO the packing was very adequate in that the machine was very well protected in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Kahler

customer_reviews.title: Search WiFi connection, not bluetooth connection with your smartphone.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the printer is capable of bluetooth printing, but it can't. I had put it back into the box for return. But after searching other printers online, it seems they are all the same. So it could be something wrong with me. I took out the printer and tested again. I realized that the printer uses regular WiFi connection, that the printer functions like a router, I should search WiFi connections with my iPhone, not bluetooth connection. That's the trick, after that everything else is as usual. I only need basic casual black-white printing, this printer should be fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: H_Review

customer_reviews.title: great printer with just a couple glitches that I fixed
customer_reviews.text: I love Canon printers. my other one lasted years. this one is great for the money. I had one major problem, because nowhere did it say it only support windows 8.1 and newer and I have 8. I called Canon and they said none of their printers support windows 8 or lower anymore. i had to upgrade to 8.1 which was a half a day project and that is fine, but they should note that on the box and on the site, which they do not. had a problem scanning, but somehow figured it out and it works fine now. lots of extra's and very happy in the end. hope it lasts as long as my other one did.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and easy to use . I love being able to print from my phone in another room. Makes things so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Works great out of the box, no software was needed to print using my phone.
customer_reviews.text: The Canon ts5120 is a great printer/scanner combo at an incredible price. I purchased it for less than $60. The print quality is excellent. Out of the box I used the auto connection and paired it to my router, immediately I was able to use it on my phone and find it without any additional software, my friends was also able to connect using their own phone and print without problems. Scanner and Copy features have also worked flawlessly and without issues. Satisfied customer and they include the color and black cartridge with this purchase. Definitely worth the buy. A++
customer_reviews.author: AmandaPrime

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and wireless
customer_reviews.text: For what I paid for it is a great printer. Comes with full cartridges of ink and has a scanner. You can print off your phone and computer wirelessly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I ever owned
customer_reviews.text: It takes forever to start up and shut down. It gobbles ink. The Windows 10 driver is buggy. Very, very rudimentary front panel. Paper often jams. It prints very slowly. And mine likes to try printing for a minute or two and then announce ERROR 6004. According to the documentation that means "the printer had an error - turn it off and on again - if that doesn't solve things send it back to Canon for repair." It is obvious to me why one set of ink cartridges costs more than the new printer did. I just threw it in the garbage in favor of a decent HP printer.
customer_reviews.author: FXDF

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in December, 2019 and did not like it at first. I didn't know what I had done with the instructions to this day. So day by day, I started to get one surprise after another in the performance. I couldn't figure out how to print a simple document on the printer but after fiddling with the display prompts, I finally got it and discovered some other things it can do. Like printing front to back from the computer or printer. I didn't know it had those capabilities. I just discovered a tray in the back Duh! I went from hate to love with this simple printer.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Harris-Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: It's an inkjet -- they are disposable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a retired IT professional. When someone inkjet printer needed repair we didn't. We just replaced it because inkjet printers are so inexpensive. The man-hours would be more than the cost of a new printer. So I replaced a Canon inkjet I've had for about 5 years with this one. I'm happy. It prints as I expected, and many of the features are similar to my old inkjet. I had no trouble connecting wirelessly with my MacBook pro, my iPad and my iPhone. It is a pleasure to print wirelessly and even more so to print from tablet or phone. Love the print quality.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Excruciatingly Slow and Extremely Difficult to set-up
customer_reviews.text: It processes print requests occasionally and extremely slow. Takes forever to clear the que. It was extremely difficult to set-up. I finally had to connect manually and for the beginner tech person this would not be easy. Also, the color ink packs are not separate. There is one pack for all colors which means i will have to replace all colors when one runs out. I prefer an ink pack for each color. I bought this printer to tide me over until I purchased a really good printer. Guess I better start looking lol. I cannot attest to print quality or picture quality as i have not had the printer finish a proect yet!
customer_reviews.author: cmcaninch

customer_reviews.title: Wireless printing is great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Wireless works really well! Scan option is very convenient. I can easily add files to add to my Dropbox.
customer_reviews.author: VMLopezIII

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with cord to connect it to computer.  Not up to usual Canon standards, IMHO.
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, directions from another planet, AND they want to hook it up to my iPhone. Okay, I"m old, but this is my 3rd Canon printer, and I'm so disappointed with this one. It comes with a disc (which I couldn't boot up) and the strangest things I've ever seen...like a flip top thin piece of plastic to access the operating panel. Or a paper tray that juts out on the front, under the flip top piece. It's too much trouble to box it all back up and tote it to UPS to return it (I really AM old), so I'll keep it for a few months and then sell it used on FB. Then I'll buy from another manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Ricia

customer_reviews.title: If you have a Chromebook get this printer!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had so many issues with wireless printers in the past I I actually think I was getting PTSD but thankfully this printer was drop dead easy to set up for my Chromebook. The manual said to follow on screen instructions for Chrome OS while thats not exactly true if you turn it off and start over it connects! All in under 12 minutes woohoo!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: This printer stopped working in less than a month, so I returned it. Tech support is only open M-F during business hours, so they're useless if you work late or on weekend. What's really frustrating is the so-called wireless feature. If you haven't used the printer in a few hours/days, it shuts down so you have to manually turn it back on before it will print. What's the purpose in having a wireless printer. Amazon was great with the return. I was refunded within one day. I was able to buy a non-Canon printer locally, with 24/7 tech support.
customer_reviews.author: MsOnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: A printer and copier... can quite call it a scanner
customer_reviews.text: So, to start, I have a Chromebook that I was hoping to use with this printer. It works as a wireless printer seamlessly. When I need to make a copy... that works too. However, I am unable to use it as a scanner. It can scan to my phone using the Canon App but thatś it. I can't even scan to a USB because there is no port... even though that option exists. I called customer service/technical support and was assured that I was not going to be able to scan to the Chromebook from the printer.
customer_reviews.author: CHESHA HODGE

customer_reviews.title: Buy from Canon, not Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Jammed the second use, called Canon for tech support and it's curious the moment I said I bought it from Amazon he knew it was a "printer issue." I got to replace it with the warranty right off. I'm finding more and more I'm replacing items I buy off Amazon using the warranty. That poor business move will eventually catch up with them. I've already canceled my prime membership. Why pay into it to have to replace so many items? Some things are better to buy directly from the company than through Amazon. Pretty sad.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use for simple home printing and copying. It’s compact which is great since I have limited space. It is easy to set up and use. I love that you can set up wireless printing from your phone &/or tablet. I find it to be quite durable as my kitties love to climb up on top for a little snooze. Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Printing quality is fantastic for me! I printed like 50 Christmas cards, I’ve used it to print loads of pictures, lots of documents, all sorts of stuff. I actually really love it. It’s easy to use and connects easily to my phone, you just need the canon printer app which is also easy to use. It’s just my first printer since the 90s and I’m very sad it won’t use ink if one is low. Very satisfied though, I’d recommend it to a friend. It also comes with both colour and black ink, and I thought they’d be sample sizes but they lasted a long time.
customer_reviews.author: kittythepancake

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even bother to buy this printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is definitely the cheapest made printer I’ve ever seen. I spent almost 3 hours with the tech people that Amazon hired to assist in the operation and set up of the printer. They did not have a clue, they referred me to Canon, which they should’ve done to begin with. Long story short, I being 63 years old was able to figure it out myself without even reading the manuals. As for touchscreen, there is not the touchscreen capability on this printer. I would never consider any other Canon product again. Hopefully Amazon does not pay a hefty fee for the horrible tech-support.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: A really great personal printer...
customer_reviews.text: Basically this printer is used by Window's 10 home versions, however, my main computer is a BSD lite_4.2 Unix Box from which most of my printing needs are for source code hard copy which is where my smart phone or Windows box comes into play. I've no drivers yet for the Unix box so files are kept on an external drive formatted with the old dos3 format making it possible to print my files from available devices. The printer is great for text as well as photo prints on photo glossy paper. I will recommend this printer for any general purpose print jobs as it prints great!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Wayt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Printer worked twice and died. I don’t need a printer on a regular basis but when you do you would hope it would work. I got an error code and when I followed the messaging on the screen it came to a bar code I scanned the bar code and it told me I needed to take it into a authorized dealer for repairs. I’m past being able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Martha B.

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏾
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th, 5th, or 6th printer... hahahahaha. By far, this is the best printer that I have purchased and one of the lowest priced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Justin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating to set up, did not work properly
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a printer that worked properly. Coincidentally, I've never purchased an expensive printer. This functioned just like every other printer I've ever owned - poorly. Frustrating to set up, forced to 'register at canon.com', etc. About three weeks after purchase, I ran out of paper. I reloaded the paper tray and it kept telling me there was no paper. So this lasted about three weeks before being thrown into a wall and then into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Burgess

customer_reviews.title: THE REPLACEMENT CARTRIDGES ARE RIDICULOUSLY EXPENSIVE!
customer_reviews.text: This printer does a fine job for what it is and what it cost. I mean, really...$50 what could be the problem? Well, it's the toner cartridges are tiny and super expensive to replace. The whole unit is tiny and I like the scanner, print quality and stuff, but it's a little quirky on the print feed-outs. BUT again, it's only $50 so what is there to complain about?...The replacement cartridges are pricey!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I WAS ABOUT TO WRITE A GLOWING REPORT ON THIS PRINTER: POPPING COLOR, IMMEDIATE PRINTER RESPONSE BUT BEFORE I COULD THE PAPER RAN OUT.OMG!! WHAT A HASSLE !! I SWEAR I WORKED ON IT FOR ONE SOLID HOUR. IT IS, OF COURSE, CHEAP PLASTIC AND I WAS CAREFUL NOT TO BREAK IT--JUST WHAT I NEED. I WAS TOLD BY DISPLAY:ERROR, REFER TO MANUAL, SCAN QR, CALL FOR SERVICE BECAUSE I JUST COULD NOT GET IT TO WORK. FINALLY, AFTER ONE HOUR, IT STARTED TO PRINT. WHAT DID I DO TO GET IT TO WORK? DON'T KNOW. MAYBE ITS ME?? BUT WHAT A HASSLE. I AM USED TO: PULL OUT, LOAD PAPER, PUSH BACK IN--PRINT. NOPE !!! NOT THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: joji

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It is very cheap, and wobbly. The tray is so light it’s hard to put in the paper. The paper has no tray so it spits the paper on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Benson

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get this printer to work with a Specific computer that is fairly new. Tech support was not helpful. Funny part is I checked to verify if this printer was compatible with that specific brand/ model before purchase. I bought this as a Christmas present kind of early so I can’t elven refund or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Sue Kuehle

customer_reviews.title: Too many issues and way too confusing
customer_reviews.text: This printer simply just isn’t good. It’s difficult and confusing to connect it to your computer, it takes forever, it’s hard to set up, it’s nearly impossible to try and add a second device for it, and there’s never any kind of instruction on their websites. Its like they just pump these things out and don’t tell anybody how they work. Just don’t waste your money with Canon printers, i’ve had 3 of them now and every single one was complete garbage
customer_reviews.author: Scott Border

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an easy to use printer and I found one here. I love to be able to connect to it with my phone and print things off with ease. Easy set up and easy use. I love how you can print pictures with it also. The scanner is not the best and the pictures seem to come out darker then what I would really like them to. But it works great for the purpose that I bought it for -- ease of use!
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: value priced...value quality...no complaints
customer_reviews.text: not a lot of features...ink doesn't last long/pricey...moderate noise (plus has a quiet feature). Only real flaw for me is the paper...holds VERY little. You will refill it often. Otherwise for basic home/school printing...Id say its good to great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi OR print. Not both.
customer_reviews.text: There was no way on earth to set this up without Canon tech-support, which is, by the way, truly excellent. That said the printer is very disappointing. As said in other reviews it’s flimsy and very slow to print. Worst of all, you can’t use the Internet and a printer at the same time, you have to keep switching back-and-forth. I found this totally unworkable. I have another Canon printer that I bought for $70 on Amazon a few years ago. This exact same printer is now $270. What’s up with that?
customer_reviews.author: Whales

customer_reviews.title: UNRELIABLE
customer_reviews.text: Printer was good for a month. Now, it won’t connect to WiFi via any avail even setup option. Manual setup on the printer, WPS setup, easy setup via the Cannon app. I finally figured out how to reset the printer to factory settings and got it reconnected. The next day, no connection. The unit went to “sleep” and lost its connection. Wont reconnect. Canon guidance on these issues is “check the router settings”. What terrible guidance. Never have issues with WiFi in my home. Never. It’s Canon. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are incomprehensible; wireless connectivity iffy
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for installing this wirelessly are insane--there must be 30 or 40 steps, confusingly written, including terms that aren't defined. Many steps give you choices to make but don't tell you why one way would be better than another. I managed to get it working, but the next day it stopped and I had to spend another 2 hours re-installing. Next day, same thing happened. Next time it happens I'm sending it back. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: sallycj

customer_reviews.title: Useless, spent 2 hours setting up wireless printing
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage. Set up is very archaic and confusing. Directions are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Swaydaa

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but trouble
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with iphone. It will not turn on automatically when I want to print from my iphone, so I must walk into my study to turn it on. It turns off automatically after use and I have not found a way to stop this. It also has gotten stuck on demanding that I use the top paper feeder, and it is also stuck on printing photo quality only, even when I specify plain paper. There is no way to change the print quality from my iphone that I have found. Very badly done, Canon.
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: The best thing about this product is......
customer_reviews.text: That it's so poorly built it will break down and I'll get a real printer in 6 months. The design of this unit is so poor, so flimsy, it's mind boggling. The software to set it up looks like it hasn't been upgraded since 1990s. It took me 30 minutes to set it up. I am already hoping it breaks down as I writ this review.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy extra ink, buy a baseball bat
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, buy a baseball bat to go with this useless pile of junk. I doubt you will need extra ink, but I promise you will want a bat. If you enjoy a printer that tells you it is out of paper when you just loaded it with paper, this is the machine for you. If you enjoy power cycling a machine for a solid hour to print one shipping label, this bitch right here is the one If you like flying into a rage and smashing appliances into bits due to their lack of functionality, this pile of garbage will do the trick
customer_reviews.author: Wynar

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this product
customer_reviews.text: have had it less than a month and already have issue with it.. the operation panel is open and still get operation panel is closed error...since I have not had any problems with printers before I threw away the box it came in and now I have no way of returning this piece of crap...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Huttton

customer_reviews.title: "All-in-one" is a lie. This is basically a printer with a couple of tricks.
customer_reviews.text: As an "all-in-1" I expect some basic capabilities, including the ability to scan a stack of documents, and this printer lacks that. You can scan "multiple" originals -- if they will all fit on the platen at the same time. But the basic "let me scan a stack of documents"? Not at all. OTOH it does have a rear tray so I can print oddball sizes of paper, including envelopes and card stock, and it does have duplex printing, so that's something.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Gold

product_meta.title: Canon TS5120 Wireless All-In-One Printer with Scanner and Copier: Mobile and Tablet Printing, with Airprint(TM) and Google Cloud Print compatible, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackMeet the Pixma TS5120 wireless inkjet all in one home printer a great all around printer made to handle all of your everyday printing needs. With the TS5120 easily print documents, forms, and concert tickets and even great looking borderless1 photos. Connect the way you want to with the features you'd expect like AirPrint2, Google cloud Print3 and with fi4 with the built in scanner you can make copies quickly and scan important documents right to your smartphone using the Canon print App5. Welcome to easy document & photo printing, right at home. Scanner Type: Flatbed.
feature_bullets: Enjoy the simplicity of connecting your smartphone, tablet and all your favorite devices with ease. Print hassle free even from the Cloud4, Bluetooth6, and from social media.5
Compact size: the PIXMA TS5120 is the Wireless all in one printer that's just the right size with all the right features; Reduction / Enlargement: 25 percent 400 percent
With features like AirPrint 2, auto power on/off, built in Wi Fi 1 and PIXMA cloud Link4 it's easy to see why the PIXMA TS5120 makes printing quick and easy
OS compatibility: Windows: Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 7 SP1 Mac: Mac OS X v10.10.5 - macOS v10.12 (Sierra) Mobile Operating Systems: iOS, AndroidTM, Windows 10 Mobile, and Amazon Fire devices22

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars4,852 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
